intro: Eriocaulon miquelianum var. miquelianum, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant produces spikelets that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils, often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
